Package de.tum.cit.fop.maze

Class Wall

java.lang.Object
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.Wall
public class Wall extends Object
Represents a moving wall in the game maze that can interact with player, friends and grievers. Handles wall movement, collision detection, and state management.

  • Constructor Details

    • Wall

      public Wall(int x, int y, String direction, com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMapTileLayer layer, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Griever> grievers, HUD hud)
      Constructs a Wall object with initial position and game properties.
      Parameters:
      x - Initial x-coordinate of the wall
      y - Initial y-coordinate of the wall
      direction - Movement direction of the wall
      layer - Tiled map layer containing the wall
      grievers - List of grievers in the game
      hud - Heads-up display for game state tracking

  • Method Details

    • createWallsFromLayer

      public static List<Wall> createWallsFromLayer(com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMapTileLayer movingWallsLayer, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Griever> grievers, HUD hud)
      Creates wall objects from a tiled map layer with moving wall properties.
      Parameters:
      movingWallsLayer - The tiled map layer containing wall tiles
      grievers - List of grievers in the game
      hud - Heads-up display for game state
      Returns:
      List of Wall objects created from the layer

      Updates wall movement and checks for collisions with game entities.
      Parameters:
      delta - Time since last frame
      globalTimer - Overall game timer

      spawned - True if the key has spawned, false otherwise

    • saveWallState

      public void saveWallState()
      Saves the current state of walls, including griever and key states. Stores information in game preferences for potential game restoration.

    • loadWallState

      public void loadWallState()
      Loads previously saved wall state from game preferences. Restores griever and key states to their previous configuration.
